name: Compiling Success: A Path Forward for FHE in Web3
description:
While privacy has become increasingly crucial for web3, what once was the holy grail of cryptography supporting private computation has fallen by the wayside. Why is that? 

We’ll take a look at what needs to happen to make fully homomorphic encryption usable for real world web3 applications. We’ll address technical challenges on the implementation and integration front, concluding with if and how building a compiler can solve many of the present day issues of fully homomorphic encryption.

speakers.name: Rick Weber
speakers.bio:
Rick is an engineer at Sunscreen where he works on making both FHE and 
ZKPs easy for engineers to use. He's contributed to a number of open 
source projects both in and out of cryptography. Passionate about user 
(as well as his own) privacy, Rick is very wary of using most social 
media applications. He also loves talking about hardware and GPUs (which
 he worked on in a past life as part of his PhD).
